items.message: The Aldingbourne and Barnham Rifes are currently falling, following an extremely wet November. Flooding may continue to affect fields near Shripney Lane and the A259, the car park at Tesco and Riverside Caravan Centre and Rowan Park Caravan Park. Only minor flood impacts are expected in Barnham. The Aldingbourne and Barnham Rifes should slowly fall all week. However, through Shripney and Bersted minor flood impacts may still continue through this weekend. It will likely take a fortnight of dry weather for river levels to return nearer to normal. River levels will remain sensitive to future rainfall. Please plan to avoid driving through routes vulnerable to flooding, including Shripney Lane. We continue to routinely clear grilles through Barnham, including at the Trading Post and our pumps at Felpham are running to reduce flood risk. We will update this message by 11:00 04/12/2022.

items.description: River Evenlode from Moreton in Marsh to Cassington and also the River Glyme at Wootton and Woodstock
items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain in low lying areas near rivers and streams. The forecast today, 03/12/22, is mainly dry with the possibility of isolated showers. 
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary. Please refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

River levels remain high but steady at the Brimscombe river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall, consequently flooding of roads and farmland continues. We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Elmore to Sharpness. Other locations that may be affected include Chalford, Leonard Stanley and Cambridge. We expect river levels to remain high over the next few days and are closely monitoring the situation. This message will be updated by 10:00am on 04/12/22 or as the situation changes.

River levels continue to remain very close to the flood alert level at the Briantspuddle river gauge on the River Piddle as a result of the heavy rainfall last weekend. River levels have been fairly steady over the last few days but can still pose a flood risk between Alton Pancras and Wareham. No rain is forecast today or tomorrow. We are closely monitoring the situation and our incident response staff have been out checking defences. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded. Please refer to the local authority website for local road closures. This message will be updated by 12:00 noon on Monday, 05/12/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Leach from Northleach to Mill Lane near Lechlade
